derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: of US origin; perhaps related to German pochen 'to brag', Pochspiel 'bragging game'

entry.def: Poker is a card game that people usually play in order to win money.

example.ex: Lon and I play in the same weekly poker game.
example.tran: 我和朗每周和同一帮人聚在一起打扑克。

entry.def: A poker is a metal bar which you use to move coal or wood in a fire in order to make it burn better.

example.ex: Mrs Malone took up the poker and stirred at the little fire burning beside her.
example.tran: 马隆夫人拿起拨火棒，拨弄了一下身旁燃烧着的小火。

means.word_mean: 1. fire iron consisting of a metal rod with a handle; used to stir a fire
2. any of various card games in which players bet that they hold the highest-ranking hand

means.word_mean: (通常指人)(坐或站得)直挺挺的，僵硬的

sentences.en: The old lady was sitting upright in her chair, stiff as a poker.
sentences.cn: 那老妇人端坐在椅子上，身体挺得笔直。
